translation.title: Upavāṇa on What is Visible in This Very Life

segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 35
segments.en: Linked Discourses 35

segments.pli: 7. Migajālavagga
segments.en: 7. With Migajāla

segments.pli: 70. Upavāṇasandiṭṭhikasutta
segments.en: 70. Upavāṇa on What is Visible in This Very Life

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā upavāṇo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami … pe …
segments.en: Then Venerable Upavāṇa went up to the Buddha …

segments.pli: ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā upavāṇo bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: and said to him:

segments.pli: “‘sandiṭṭhiko dhammo, sandiṭṭhiko dhammo’ti, bhante, vuccati.
segments.en: “Sir, they speak of ‘a teaching visible in this very life’.

segments.pli: Kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, sandiṭṭhiko dhammo hoti, akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhī”ti?
segments.en: In what way is the teaching visible in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves?”

segments.pli: “Idha pana, upavāṇa, bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā rūpappaṭisaṃvedī ca hoti rūparāgappaṭisaṃvedī ca.
segments.en: “Upavāṇa, take a mendicant who sees a sight with their eyes. They experience both the sight and the desire for the sight.

segments.pli: Santañca ajjhattaṃ rūpesu rāgaṃ ‘atthi me ajjhattaṃ rūpesu rāgo’ti pajānāti.
segments.en: There is desire for sights in them, and they understand that.

segments.pli: Yaṃ taṃ, upavāṇa, bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā rūpappaṭisaṃvedī ca hoti rūparāgappaṭisaṃvedī ca.
segments.en: Since this is so,

segments.pli: Santañca ajjhattaṃ rūpesu rāgaṃ ‘atthi me ajjhattaṃ rūpesu rāgo’ti pajānāti.
Evampi kho, upavāṇa, sandiṭṭhiko dhammo hoti akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhi … pe ….
segments.en: this is how the teaching is visible in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, upavāṇa, bhikkhu jivhāya rasaṃ sāyitvā rasappaṭisaṃvedī ca hoti rasarāgappaṭisaṃvedī ca.
segments.en: Next, take a mendicant who hears … smells … tastes … touches …

segments.pli: Santañca ajjhattaṃ rasesu rāgaṃ ‘atthi me ajjhattaṃ rasesu rāgo’ti pajānāti.
Yaṃ taṃ, upavāṇa, bhikkhu jivhāya rasaṃ sāyitvā rasappaṭisaṃvedī ca hoti rasarāgappaṭisaṃvedī ca.
Santañca ajjhattaṃ rasesu rāgaṃ ‘atthi me ajjhattaṃ rasesu rāgo’ti pajānāti. Evampi kho, upavāṇa, sandiṭṭhiko dhammo hoti akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhi … pe ….
Puna caparaṃ, upavāṇa, bhikkhu manasā dhammaṃ viññāya dhammappaṭisaṃvedī ca hoti dhammarāgappaṭisaṃvedī ca.
segments.en: Next, take a mendicant who knows a thought with their mind. They experience both the thought and the desire for the thought.

segments.pli: Santañca ajjhattaṃ dhammesu rāgaṃ ‘atthi me ajjhattaṃ dhammesu rāgo’ti pajānāti.
segments.en: There is desire for thoughts in them, and they understand that.

segments.pli: Yaṃ taṃ, upavāṇa, bhikkhu manasā dhammaṃ viññāya dhammappaṭisaṃvedī ca hoti dhammarāgappaṭisaṃvedī ca.
segments.en: Since this is so,

segments.pli: Santañca ajjhattaṃ dhammesu rāgaṃ ‘atthi me ajjhattaṃ dhammesu rāgo’ti pajānāti.
Evampi kho, upavāṇa, sandiṭṭhiko dhammo hoti … pe … paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhi … pe ….
segments.en: this is how the teaching is visible in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.

segments.pli: Idha pana, upavāṇa, bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā rūpappaṭisaṃvedī ca hoti, no ca rūparāgappaṭisaṃvedī.
segments.en: Take a mendicant who sees a sight with their eyes. They experience the sight but no desire for the sight.

segments.pli: Asantañca ajjhattaṃ rūpesu rāgaṃ ‘natthi me ajjhattaṃ rūpesu rāgo’ti pajānāti.
segments.en: There is no desire for sights in them, and they understand that.

segments.pli: Yaṃ taṃ, upavāṇa, bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā rūpappaṭisaṃvedīhi kho hoti, no ca rūparāgappaṭisaṃvedī.
segments.en: Since this is so,

segments.pli: Asantañca ajjhattaṃ rūpesu rāgaṃ ‘natthi me ajjhattaṃ rūpesu rāgo’ti pajānāti.
Evampi kho, upavāṇa, sandiṭṭhiko dhammo hoti, akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhi … pe ….
segments.en: this is how the teaching is visible in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, upavāṇa, bhikkhu jivhāya rasaṃ sāyitvā rasappaṭisaṃvedīhi kho hoti, no ca rasarāgappaṭisaṃvedī. Asantañca ajjhattaṃ rasesu rāgaṃ ‘natthi me ajjhattaṃ rasesu rāgo’ti pajānāti … pe ….
segments.en: Next, take a mendicant who hears … smells … tastes … touches …

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, upavāṇa, bhikkhu manasā dhammaṃ viññāya dhammappaṭisaṃvedīhi kho hoti, no ca dhammarāgappaṭisaṃvedī.
Asantañca ajjhattaṃ dhammesu rāgaṃ ‘natthi me ajjhattaṃ dhammesu rāgo’ti pajānāti.
Yaṃ taṃ, upavāṇa, bhikkhu manasā dhammaṃ viññāya dhammappaṭisaṃvedīhi kho hoti, no ca dhammarāgappaṭisaṃvedī.
segments.en: Next, take a mendicant who knows a thought with their mind. They experience the thought but no desire for the thought.

segments.pli: Asantañca ajjhattaṃ dhammesu rāgaṃ ‘natthi me ajjhattaṃ dhammesu rāgo’ti pajānāti.
segments.en: There is no desire for thoughts in them, and they understand that.

segments.pli: Evampi kho, upavāṇa, sandiṭṭhiko dhammo hoti, akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhī”ti.
segments.en: Since this is so, this is how the teaching is visible in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.”

segments.pli: Aṭṭhamaṃ.

sections.title: Then Venerable Upavāṇa went up to the Buddha ……

suttaplex.blurb: The teaching that can be realized in this very life is the desire for the senses, and letting go of that desire.
